title: Elevator Modular System
description: Drag and drop, easy to use modular system.
longDescription:
Video Demonstration : Elevator System Demo - Unreal 5

Realistic modular system that can be used, customized and scaled with few clicks. With first person and third person support. Each floor can have different distances from each other, including gaps.

Unlock the Elevator of Your Dreams with Our Expertly Crafted, Time-Saving Blueprint Asset for Unreal Engine!

Embark on a game-changing journey with our meticulously designed Elevator Blueprint Asset, exclusively tailored for Unreal Engine. Say goodbye to the complexities of building elevators from scratch, as our comprehensive asset streamlines the process, saving you valuable time and effort.

  • Masterful Complexity:

Creating an authentic elevator experience can be challenging, but fear not! Our blueprint is a testament to unparalleled craftsmanship and attention to detail, carefully crafted to ensure realistic behavior and functionality.

  • Save Precious Development Time:

We understand that time is of the essence in game development. Our Elevator Blueprint Asset acts as your dedicated time-saver, allowing you to focus on other critical aspects of your project while still achieving a top-notch elevator experience.

Key Features:

  • Seamless Integration: Designed specifically for Unreal Engine, our asset effortlessly integrates into your existing project, reducing the learning curve.
  • Intelligent Automation: From floor detection to door operation, our blueprint automates intricate processes, making your elevators feel truly lifelike.
  • Aesthetic Customization: Tailor the elevator's appearance to your exact specifications, with a range of options to choose from for a polished, professional look.
  • Sound Immersion: Elevate your game's audio with our diverse sound library, featuring realistic elevator sounds that add depth and immersion.

Elevate Your Game with Ease:

Gone are the days of complex elevator development! Let our Elevator Blueprint Asset be your guiding light, as it simplifies the process and propels your game to new heights.

Grab Your Copy Today and Unleash the Power of Effortless Elevator Creation in Unreal Engine!

How to import into your project :

  1. Open the project folder (this product).
  2. Open "Content" folder.
  3. Copy "ElevatorSystem" folder.
  4. Paste it under "Content" folder in your project.
  5. If you want to use this product characters, you should also copy "Config" folder or just the "DefaultInput" file.


Note: If you downloaded version 5.1 of this product for exemple, you should copy it into a 5.1+ project.
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • Up to 50 floors ( 40 floors + 10 underground floors)
  • First person and third person support
  • Everything can be easily scaled, moved or removed. You can change the size of every mesh of the elevator on blueprint
  • You can customize the elevator dragging and dropping different materials on each part ( floor, walls, panel, etc)
  • Jamb floor plates and floor buttons that detects the floor and will be shown automatically
  • Floors will be automatically detected and will be shown on display
  • 10 different sounds, (button bip, button noise, alarm , door moving, elevator moving, emergency call, stop door move 01 ,stop door move 02, elevator start, and elevator bell)
  •  External call button
  • Digital panel showing current floor, lift direction
  • Interior panel, button with lights and emergency buttons that can be deactivated
  • Doors can be opened automatically, and manually by pushing buttons
  • 5 door speeds and 5 elevator speeds
  • Shaft walls split in 3 parts tha can be easily added/removed, one by one.
  • Blueprint widget with crosshair that detects the buttons and turn green whem you can push it
  • Lock jump system.
  • 68 textures and 7 materials ( 1K, 2K, 4k versions for the MuiltSurface material( main material used) and 1K for floor number textures
  • 125 meshes, 26 ~ 2034 triangles each mesh

Blueprints: 5

Input: Keyboard

Network Replicated: No

Platforms: Windows

Documentation: Elevator System How to Add Floors - Unreal 5

Implementation commented on: BP_FirstPersonCharacter and BP_ThirdPersonCharacter
